p: Next, we asked whether the WT and mutant viruses exhibit differential sensitivity to FMRP depletion. We observed that Δ10 ZIKV infection rate in HeLa cells is reduced compared to WT ZIKV under negative control conditions (~11% vs~25% infected cells) and, importantly, FMRP KD disproportionately enhanced Δ10 ZIKV infection rate ( Figure 5C): whereas WT virus was enhanced by approximately 3-fold, the infection rate for Δ10 ZIKV rose by nearly 5-fold ( Figure 5D). Representative scatter plots depicting the infected cell populations are shown in Figure 5—figure supplement 1. Additionally, similar effects were observed on levels of cell-associated ZIKV NS2B and NS4B proteins ( Figure 5E to G). Together, these results suggest that sfRNA antagonizes FMRP and thus enhances ZIKV infection.
